alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 1:36PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy snow showers with a few embedded squalls will impact portions of southern Clinton, east central Franklin, northeastern Essex, Grand Isle, northwestern Chittenden and Franklin Counties through 215 PM EST... At 134 PM EST, snow showers extended along a line from North Hero to near Grand Isle to near Schuyler Falls to 8 miles west of Clayburg. Movement was east-southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, and visibility as low as one quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. A quick accumulation of up to 1 inch is possible in heavier activity. Locations impacted include... Plattsburgh, Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, South Burlington, Peru, Schuyler Falls, Saranac, Enosburg Falls, Franklin, Colchester, Sheldon, Georgia, Au Sable Forks, Grand Isle, St. Albans Town, South Alburgh, Enosburg Falls Village, Alburgh Dunes State Park, North Hero and Milton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 138 and 159. Interstate 89 between mile markers 95 and 130.
